pullRequest.body:
Makes `Algebra.FinitePresentation` a class, matching `Algebra.FiniteType`. Changes theorems to instances where possible.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5412044e-06bc-40c6-9e62-6ffdfb2dd804) for commit 1c21e6d87fea3906cac06740c821df9418f89226.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3e090bd6-b749-4c92-add2-25e95880f1be) for commit acebb0c7d4e502fbfc62dff6ab23fce1cd284e26.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5f88420c-4679-434a-aa2e-62661ab9384b/to/3e090bd6-b749-4c92-add2-25e95880f1be) against commit 45d128c7aa87ab920877b9844a7076efbb0be8fc.

> I worry slightly that:
> 
> ```lean
> def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
>   @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
> ```
> 
> is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise. Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

I stuck to the design of `RingHom.FiniteType` here, which should have the same issue?

> I worry slightly that:
> 
> ```lean
> 
> def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
> 
>   @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
> 
> ```
> 
> is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise.
> 
> Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

The transparency differences between the two could be one source of trouble but since there is no data here I think that risk is minimized. What other spots come to mind?

Should this be an `abbrev` anyway?
It would be nice to minimize the named instance parameters.

I think this looks good. Thanks.

bors merge
Thanks for the reviews!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8680766943/job/23802042369)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8680766943/job/23802042319)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8680766943/job/23802042235)

I worry slightly that:
```lean
def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
  @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
```
is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise.
Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

I worry slightly that:
```lean
def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
  @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
```
is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise.
Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(RingTheory/FinitePresentation): make `Algebra.FinitePresentation` a class

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5412044e-06bc-40c6-9e62-6ffdfb2dd804) for commit 1c21e6d87fea3906cac06740c821df9418f89226.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3e090bd6-b749-4c92-add2-25e95880f1be) for commit acebb0c7d4e502fbfc62dff6ab23fce1cd284e26.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5f88420c-4679-434a-aa2e-62661ab9384b/to/3e090bd6-b749-4c92-add2-25e95880f1be) against commit 45d128c7aa87ab920877b9844a7076efbb0be8fc.

I worry slightly that:
```lean
def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
  @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
```
is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise.
Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

> I worry slightly that:
> 
> ```lean
> def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
>   @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
> ```
> 
> is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise. Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

I stuck to the design of `RingHom.FiniteType` here, which should have the same issue?

> I worry slightly that:
> 
> ```lean
> 
> def FinitePresentation (f : A →+* B) : Prop :=
> 
>   @Algebra.FinitePresentation A B _ _ f.toAlgebra
> 
> ```
> 
> is going to be trouble, as this is a typeclass when unfolded but not otherwise.
> 
> Maybe this is just superstition left from Lean 3; no action needed unless another reviewer is also worried.

The transparency differences between the two could be one source of trouble but since there is no data here I think that risk is minimized. What other spots come to mind?

Should this be an `abbrev` anyway?
It would be nice to minimize the named instance parameters.

I think this looks good. Thanks.
